10:52 <+Denis> lucaa: I was aware of that subwiki creation issue, but I do not agree that I had introduced it, since the way it works before was to do many updateSchema, just in case of, which was really a poor design.  
10:53 <+Denis> your conclusion are right however, the delete wiki operation does not clean the cache of initialized wikis, and cause the issue. Therefore, it should be fixed there, during wiki deletion, we should remove the wiki from the list of initialized wikis.  
10:54 <+Denis> the best would be to not have this list in first place

18:01 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* rbe17648 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/be17648ee0067f85717c1927feed84fea0f88319 / xwiki-rendering-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/listener/MetaData.java : Fix checkstyle - http://git.io/\_jALKg  
18:59 <jamie\_\_wiki> has joined #xwiki  
19:01 <jamie\_\_wiki> hello  
19:12 <jamie\_\_wiki> I remember reading on the documentation somewhere that multiple authentication types was a feature that you wanted to add at some point.  
19:13 <vmassol> jamie\_\_wiki: multiple at once you mean?  
19:13 <vmassol> because multiple is already implemented  
19:14 <jamie\_\_wiki> vmassol: yes.. at once.. not switching out one for another?  
19:16 <vmassol> right we don't have chaining implemented AFAIK but I guess it's possible (easy?) to write a new Authenticator that will do the chaining  
19:20 <jamie\_\_wiki> I'll take a look..  I've been using Apache Shiro in some other programming that supports multiple authentication / authorization types chained etc..    it uses a filter and threadlocal set/unset and the beginning and end of request for subsequent code to access the logged in user and their permissions without passing the user etc in parameters..  
19:21 <vmassol> ok, I'm not too familiar with xwiki's authentication but I'm sure it can be improved by using more "standards"  
19:21 <jamie\_\_wiki> just thought I would throw that out there..  I thought I remembered a proposal for authentication somewhere :)  
19:22 <vmassol> :)
